description: Great Lodges of the National Parks tells the stories behind these national treasures and showcases the many ways to enjoy their beauty. Explore a glowing caldera in Hawaii, the peaks and lakes of the Rockies, an oasis in Californi...
name: Great Lodges of the National Parks

original_info.id: Great Lodges of the National Parks: Glacier Lodges | Pacific Northwest Lodges_2002
original_info.name: Great Lodges of the National Parks: Glacier Lodges / Pacific Northwest Lodges

review.name: It makes you want to pack your things and go!
review.reviewBody:
"Great Lodges of the National Parks" is a short series by Oregon Public Television about some of our great lodges. However, despite the title, they are not all in national parks but also in national forests and national monuments--all government owned, though the hotels are run by private companies. All are found in the western United States, by the way.

The show consists of several lodges highlighted per episode. In some, they show several lodges per park, others just one. The history of these places is discussed, there are LOTS of interviews with folks who work there and there are tons of old photos--all accompanied by majestic music. The bottom line is that the films are very enjoyable--quite beautiful and they really make you want to pack your bags and see these wonderful places yourself. Very well made.
